content: evenly up right front edge to neckband and 3 sts evenly up neckband shape shoulder 37 44 53 59 63 69 sts next row rs cast off 8 9 10 11 11 12 sts k to end knit 3 row 8 9 10 11 12 13 sts buttonhole row 1 rs k23 30 37 36 38 42 cast off 2 sts 1 st left next row k to end on rh needle k6 6 8 6 7 8 cast off 2 sts 1 st left on rh needle cast off rem 8 9 10 11 12 13 sts 1 1 1 2 2 2 times k2 with rs facing and working on rem 31 35 37 41 44 48 sts slip first buttonhole row 2 k3 cast on 2 sts k7 7 9 7 8 9 cast on 2 sts 13 15 15 17 19 21 sts onto a stitch holder for neckband rejoin yarn 1 1 1 2 2 2 times k23 30 37 36 38 42 to rem 18 20 22 24 25 27 sts and k to end knit 3 row next row ws k to end cast off knitwise next row rs neck edge k2tog k to end 17 19 21 23 24 26 sts repeat last 2 row once more 16 18 20 22 23 25 sts left front border work 4 row without shaping with rs facing and using 3 25mm needles beg at neck edge shape shoulder of left front pick up and knit 3 sts evenly down neckband and 34 41 50 56 60 66 sts evenly down left front edge next row ws cast off 8 9 10 11 11 12 sts k to end 37 44 53 59 63 69 sts 8 9 10 11 12 13 sts knit 8 row next row k to end cast off knitwise cast off rem 8 9 10 11 12 13 sts making up sleeves both alike insert sleeves by folding each sleeve in half lengthwise and place using 3 25mm needles cast on 28 30 32 34 36 38 sts and work fold to shoulder seam sew in position between markers join side 4 row in g-st as given for back and sleeve seams sew on buttons matching buttonholes change to 4mm needles and cont in g-st throughout weave in ends and pin your garment out to size stated in the pattern work 4 row without shaping cover with a damp cloth and leave to dry increase row rs kfb k to last 2 sts kfb k1 30 32 34 36 38 40 sts work 7 7 7 7 9 9 row without shaping in g-st 6 design west yorkshire spinners technical editors helen birch faye perriam-reed and copyright chloé elizabeth birch the design in this pattern is
